events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred on the highway, involving a rear-end collision with another vehicle. They filed the claim immediately after the incident.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to the nature of the report mentioning collision and vehicle damage.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to assist the customer with the claim process and provide necessary guidance.
The claim was officially acknowledged by the company, notifying the customer that their case is being processed with priority.
The agent requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police accident report, and a copy of the driver's license to proceed with the claim.
The customer submitted all the requested documents including images of the vehicle damage and the official police report for review.
The investigation team began analyzing the submitted documentation and accident circumstances to determine the claim's validity.
The investigation concluded that the customer's vehicle sustained moderate damage and the accident was caused by the other party’s fault.
A settlement offer was presented to the customer based on the repair estimates and coverage limits detailed in the insurance policy.
The customer responded positively to the settlement offer, expressing satisfaction with the proposed compensation and communication.
The claim was approved by the insurance company management, confirming the acceptance of the settlement and repair costs.
Payment was disbursed to the customer’s designated account to cover the repair expenses for the damaged vehicle.
The claim was officially closed after the payment issuance and confirmation that the customer had received the funds.
